ch.pschatzmann.jflightcontroller4pi.devices

Class QuadMotorController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.pschatzmann.jflightcontroller4pi.devices.QuadMotorController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFrequency, IDevice, IOutDevice

    public class QuadMotorController
extends java.lang.Object
implements IOutDevice
    Implementation of a simple motor controller for Quadrotors. The target pitch, roll, yaw and speed are read from the parameters and then translated with the help of PIDs to motor output values. Here is a overview schema of the quadrotor motors: x1 x2 | | | | x3 x4 yaw -> x1 / x4 > x2 / x3 pitch -> x1 / x2 < x3 / x4 roll -> x1 / x3 > x2 /x4 speed -> x1 x2 x3 x4 The Motors 1/4 and 3/2 are spinning their motors in opposite direction. Roll is generated by giving aymetric power to the motors on the left and right side. Pitch is generated by giving aysmetric power to the front and back motors and yaw is controlled by giving the right spinning motors asymetric power compared to the left spinning motors.
